Legal_Issue: Whether the Athletic Club trade-mark is invalid under sections 12(1)(b), 12(1)(c), and 10 of the Trade-marks Act
Evidence_Assessment: Cross-examinations, newspaper articles, Yellow Pages listings, corporate/trade-name searches
Decision_Outcome: The Athletic Club trade-mark declared invalid
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant (Ottawa Athletic Club) to prove invalidity
Credibility_Factor: Evidence of widespread industry use of 'athletic club' prior to 1997
Legal_Rule: A trade-mark is invalid if it is clearly descriptive, the name of services, or prohibited by ordinary commercial usage
Standard_of_Review: Correctness for questions of law, reasonableness for factual inferences
Procedural_Issue: Admissibility and weight of historical commercial usage evidence
Grounds_for_Claim: Descriptiveness, genericness, and prohibition under commercial usage
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Trade-mark invalidated and removed from register
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation and application of Trade-marks Act provisions
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Court conducted full evidentiary analysis with cross-examination
Key_Evidence_Considered: Use of 'athletic club' in industry publications, directories, and business names before 1997
Applicant_Challenge: Seeking invalidation of The Athletic Club trade-mark due to confusion and descriptiveness
Court_Result: Trade-mark declared invalid and ordered removed from the register
Legal_Rule_Source: Sections 12(1)(b), 12(1)(c), and 10 of the Trade-marks Act
Defendant_Response: Likely defended mark as distinctive due to design elements, though unsuccessful
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, public records, commercial usage data
Remedy_Requested: Invalidation of trade-mark and removal from register
Remedy_Sought: Removal of trade-mark from official register
Legal_Provision: Sections 12(1)(b), 12(1)(c), and 10 of the Trade-marks Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections 12(1)(b), 12(1)(c), and 10 of the Trade-marks Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Mark is clearly descriptive, generic, and prohibited by commercial usage
Applicable_Process: Federal court proceeding under the Trade-marks Act
Outcome_of_Review: In favor of applicant – trade-mark struck from register
Governing_Rule: Trade-marks Act, particularly rules on registrability and prohibited marks
